wikipedia_page.main: Joe Kiernan (22 October 1942 – August 2006) was a Scottish professional footballer who played 352 matches for Northampton Town. He played either on the left side of defence or midfield.

response: Banks missed the first nine games of the 1965–66 season after breaking his wrist when diving at the feet of Northampton Town's Joe Kiernan in a pre-season friendly. Leicester finished the season in seventh spot, and exited both cup competitions at the hands of Manchester City.

response: *Most appearances in the first tier (Premier League and predecessors) – 42 by Joe Kiernan
*Most League Cup appearances – 25 by Joe Kiernan (4 November 1963 – 18 August 1972) and Peter Gleasure (29 August 1983 – 10 October 1990)
